items.title: Building AI Systems at Scale
items.excerpt: Lessons learned from deploying ML models that serve millions of requests...
items.author: Smrita Pandey
items.content:
## Introduction

When deploying machine learning models in production environments, the challenges extend far beyond model accuracy. In this post, I'll share lessons learned from building and scaling AI systems that serve millions of users.

## Key Considerations

### 1. Infrastructure

The foundation of any scalable AI system is robust infrastructure. This includes:

- **Model serving**: Using optimized inference servers
- **Auto-scaling**: Dynamic resource allocation based on demand
- **Monitoring**: Real-time performance metrics and alerting

### 2. Data Pipeline

A reliable data pipeline is crucial:

```python
def process_data(raw_data):
    # Clean and validate
    cleaned = validate_schema(raw_data)
    
    # Feature engineering
    features = extract_features(cleaned)
    
    return features
```

### 3. Model Versioning

Always version your models and maintain rollback capabilities.

## Conclusion

Building AI at scale is as much about engineering as it is about data science. The best models are useless without proper infrastructure.

items.title: The Art of Product Thinking
items.excerpt: How I approach building products that users actually love...
items.author: Smrita Pandey
items.content:
## Thinking About Products

Product thinking is both an art and a science. When building products that serve real users, every decision matters.

## Core Principles

### Start With the User

Don't build what you think is cool — build what your users need. Talk to them, observe them, understand their pain points.

### Design for Failure

Everything fails eventually. Design your products to be resilient and forgiving.

### Measure Everything

What you can't measure, you can't improve.

## Common Patterns

- **User research**: Talking to real people before writing code
- **Rapid prototyping**: Getting something tangible fast
- **Iterative improvement**: Ship, learn, improve, repeat

## What I've Learned

1. **Simple beats clever** — Users don't care about your architecture
2. **Speed wins** — Ship fast, iterate faster
3. **Listen more** — Your users know best

items.title: From Code to CEO
items.excerpt: My journey transitioning from writing code to building companies...
items.author: Smrita Pandey
items.content:
## The Journey

My path from writing code to building companies wasn't planned. It evolved naturally from solving problems I cared about.

## What Changed

As a developer, I focused on building great products. As a founder, I had to think about:

- Vision and strategy
- Team building
- Business development
- Customer relationships

## Lessons Learned

1. **Code is just one part** — The best product doesn't always win
2. **People matter most** — Your team makes or breaks you
3. **Stay technical** — Don't lose touch with the craft

## What's Next

I'm still learning every day. The journey continues...

---
